Balance Sheet

A balance sheet is a snapshot of a company's financial position at a single point in time. The balance sheet can also be refered to as the statement of financial position or the statement of financial condition.

A balance sheet lists the company's permanent accounts: assets, liabilities, and equity. The company's lifetime of revenue/expense activities are indirectly shown on the balance sheet through the equity section of the report (retained earnings).

The balance sheet provides answers to the following questions:

  • How liquid is the company?
  • How much debt does the company carry?
  • How much stuff does the company own?
  • How is the company funded? (debt to equity ratio)
  • How much have owners invested into the company?
